file_content.text: Those Rendili shuttles are going to be worth their weight in aurodium. I owe you one for keeping my guys safe.
Nice work! We're pushing through the access tunnel now. They'll be at the controls of those shuttles in no time.
Let's hope those shuttles make a real difference.
That's good news.
Bet on it. I'll be moving out to the rendezvous point in a few.
It was a piece of cake.
Ha! I guess you're even better than they say. I'll be moving out for the rendezvous point in a few.
I'm not coming back to bail you out again.
Don't mess it up.
Don't worry--now that we'll have those shuttles in our hands, we're not about to lose them.
Pretty soon our flyboys will be making supply runs in some high-end hardware.
We'll be waiting for that fuel depot diversion. Just make sure the warehouse door's unlocked first.
They give you a success probability this time?
Yeah... and you don't want to know the numbers.
Master Jedi! They said you might be in the area.
Major! I heard you were in-theater.
Hey, I heard we had a privateer on the ground.
Hey, I heard we had a strike team in the area. Maybe this is our lucky day.
Bad intel almost got my guys killed trying to assault the Rendili Vehicle Corporation. Give us a hand, I'd owe you big time.
Why is a vehicle corporation a high value objective?
Sounds high priority.
I presume there's a good reason we're after a vehicle corporation?
Sounds high priority.
Brief me on your objective, sergeant.
Sounds high priority.
What's so special about Rendili Vehicle Corp?
Sounds high priority.
When the Empire took over Rendili, the personnel managed to evacuate. But they left behind some of the fastest shuttles in the galaxy.
Tell me what the problem was.
What kind of bad intel?
Mistaken info on enemy units. We're here to extract some high-tech shuttles that got left behind when the Empire seized Rendili.
Like I care.
Let me explain--we're supposed to extract some high-tech shuttles that got left behind when the Empire seized Rendili.
Suckers are quick as a Hutt double-deal. They'd be huge for supply and reinforcement runs.
Except intel missed the whole army of mercenaries the Empire stationed there. So now we gotta get clever.
We have a plan to steal those shuttles on the sly, but we'll need help with access and diversion.
I'm curious to hear what you have in mind.
Tell me the plan.
I've got a thing for clever plans. Let's hear it.
Let's hear the plan.
I've had to get clever once or twice. What's the play?
Let's hear the plan.
There's a tunnel my men can use to infiltrate the warehouse, but the door's locked from inside.
The best plans are simple plans--go in guns blazing.
We should attack directly.
Tried that one already. Listen--my men can infiltrate the warehouse through an access tunnel, but the door's locked from inside.
Just spit it out already!
Roger--here's the plan: my men can infiltrate the warehouse through an access tunnel, but the door's locked from inside.
If you're going to help, first thing is to fight your way in and unlock that door.
Next, we need a diversion. Blowing the fuel depot outside should do the trick.
Then we'll fly those shuttles out from under their noses. What do you think?
Unlock the door from inside, then blow the fuel depot. Consider it done.
I'd be honored to help.
They'll never know what hit 'em.
Sure, it'll be a snap.
See that, Yung? That's confidence.
We'll be watching for the diversion.
Sorry, sergeant. You're on your own with this one.
Not this time. [Refuse Quest]
Oh... Well, I guess we'll have to come up with something else.
I can't really talk now. We're still waiting for some men to make it back.
